snippet: In recording no votes in 79 precincts in the 13th Congressional District, a patronage-encrusted agency outdid its record for incompetence.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column faults New York City Board of Elections for mistakes made while counting votes in the Democratic primary race between State Sen Adriano Espaillat and Rep Charles B Rangel for 13th District Congressional seat; calls board incompetent, suggesting that its blind adherence to old ways of doing things has pushed its dysfunction to a new high.
lead_paragraph: In recording no votes in 79 precincts in the 13th Congressional District, a patronage-encrusted agency outdid its record for incompetence.

headline.seo: N.Y.C. Election Board Showed Dysfunction in Primary
headline.main: Election Board Sets New High in Dysfunction
headline.print_headline: Election Board Sets New High In Dysfunction
